str2: Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From en and kataleipo; to leave behind in some place, i.e. let remain over, or to desert.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
From psucho; breath, i.e. spirit, abstractly or concretely.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Hades, the unseen world. Properly, unseen, i.e. 'Hades' or the place of departed souls.
Neither, nor, not even, and not. From ou and de; not however, i.e. Neither, nor, not even.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Holy, pious, godly, beloved of God. Of uncertain affinity; properly, right, i.e. Hallowed.
Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
Destruction, decay, corruption. From diaphtheiro; decay.
